description: [African Union] The Chairperson of the African Union Commission, H.E Moussa Faki Mahamat warmly congratulates H.E Taye Atske-Selassie upon his appointment as President of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia during a joint sitting of the House of Peoples Representatives and the House of Federation today in Addis Ababa.
title: Africa: Chairperson Welcomes Appointment of New President of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Commends Tenure of Former President Zewde

description: [HIVR4P2024] Lima, Peru -- New data from the PURPOSE 2 study of twice-yearly lenacapavir for HIV prevention are among the scientific highlights at HIVR4P 2024, the 5th HIV Research for Prevention Conference, taking place in Lima, Peru, and virtually from 6 to 10 October.
title: Africa: Advances in PrEP Options and HIV Vaccine Research Unveiled at HIVR4P 2024, the 5th HIV Research for Prevention Conference

description: [The Conversation Africa] On October 10, NASA is launching a hotly anticipated new mission to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon, Europa.
title: Africa: Nasa Is Launching a Major Mission to Look for Habitable Spots On Jupiter's Moon Europa

description: [WHO-AFRO] Brazzaville -- About 40 million people live with hearing loss in the African region, but the figure could rise to 54 million by 2030 if urgent measures are not take to address the problem, according to a new World Health Organization (WHO) report.
title: Africa: Burden of Hearing Loss in Africa Could Rise to 54 Million By 2030 - WHO Report

description: [IPS] New York -- We must build a new social contract for education - a contract based on equality, equity, and universal human rights. At the center of our global efforts to ensure education for all, we must put teachers first in everything we do. They are frontlines heroes who deliver every day to educate children, cultivate young talent, and build a strong society. They are the substitute parents, the mentors and the ones who contribute to shaping the identify of a child in war, in refuge or in climate change.
title: Africa: May Teacher Voices Echo Around the Globe

description: [The Conversation Africa] For almost a decade, researchers have been gathering evidence that the social media platform Facebook disproportionately amplifies low-quality content and misinformation.
title: Africa: Is Big Tech Harming Society? to Find Out, We Need Research - but It's Being Manipulated By Big Tech Itself

description: [CAF] The 2024/25 TotalEnergies CAF Confederation Cup group stage promises thrilling action after Tunisian giants CS Sfaxien, Enyimba of Nigeria, Tanzania's Simba and Bravos do Maquis of Angola were drawn in the same group following the Group Stage draw on Monday.
title: Africa: Holders Zamalek Drawn to Face Asec, Sfaxien to Face Enyimba and Simba

description: [CAF] The road to the TotalEnergies Africa Cup of Nations, Morocco 2025, continues this week as 48 national teams across the continent gear up for another thrilling round of qualifying matches.
title: Africa: TotalEnergies Afcon 2025 Qualifiers - Matchday 3 Fixtures and Timings

description: [Premium Times] "It is crucial to know that if you have a permanent seat with a veto power, others would court you to support issues of interest to them."
title: Africa: Debate On Africa Getting Two Permanent Seats in UNSC Is a Ruse - Professor Badejo

description: [Premium Times] The People's Elephant will face a daunting task in Group D alongside defending champions Zamalek SC and Al Masry SC of Egypt, as well as Mozambican outfit A. Black Bulls.
title: Africa: Enyimba Drawn Against Egyptian Powerhouses in CAF Confederation Cup Group Stage

description: [New Times] Benin head coach Gernot Rohr has said that Rwanda poses an even more dangerous threat than before and his charges must be well equipped to face them in the forthcoming Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifier in Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire.
title: Africa: Afcon Qualifiers - Rohr Wary of Amavubi Threat

description: [New Times] The 2024 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine was jointly awarded to two American scientists Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun their work on microRNA.
title: Africa: Nobel Prize in Medicine Awarded to mRNA Researchers

description: [ISS] Can the Government of National Unity reconcile its members' competing interests and achieve a pragmatic, unified approach?
title: Africa: South Africa's GNU Faces an Uphill Battle On Migration Policy

description: [African Union] UNESCO and the African Union recently hosted a high-level partners' breakfast meeting in Addis Ababa to exchange views on safety of journalists on the continent, ahead of the 2024 International Day to End Impunity for Crimes Against Journalists (IDEI) Global Conference, scheduled for November 6-7, 2024, at the African Union HQ.
title: Africa: African Union and Unesco Convened a Strategic Partners Meeting Ahead of 2024 Safety of Journalists Global Conference

description: [African Arguments] Improving outcomes for patients requires urgent efforts to reduce the price of treatments and increase access to drugs.
title: Africa: On World Meningitis Day, Too Many People Are Dying of Cryptococcal Meningitis in Africa

description: [UN News] The year 2023 marked the driest year in over three decades for rivers around the world, according to a new report coordinated by the UN's World Meteorological Organization (WMO).
title: Africa: Water Is 'Canary in the Coalmine' of Climate Change - WMO

description: [Unicef] Johannesburg, Nairobi, Dakar, Amman -- UNICEF and the Learning for Well-being Institute publish new findings that suggest that key social spending in Africa predominantly prioritises older children while spending on the youngest significantly lags behind, in sharp contrast to G20 countries.
title: Africa: Govts in Africa Spend 16 Times Less On Younger Children Than On Older Ones, Study Finds

description: [UN News] The World Health Organization (WHO) announced on Friday that it has approved the first mpox diagnostic test for emergency use, which will boost diagnostic capacity in countries facing outbreaks of the disease.
title: Africa: WHO Approves First Mpox Diagnostic Test for Emergency Use

description: [The Conversation Africa] A recent report by the World Health Organization (WHO) estimated that 8 million people die annually from smoking related complications. Despite efforts by governments and various organisations to create awareness about the dangers, around 1.3 billion people still use some form of tobacco and 80% of them live in low to middle income countries.
title: Africa: Smokers Have a Higher Level of Harmful Bacteria in the Mouth - New Study

description: [Daily Trust] Nigerian banks have been ranked among Africa's top 100 banks in 2024, according to a report of the African Business Magazine.
title: Africa: 8 Nigerian Banks Rank Among Africa's Top 100

description: [HRW] Honoring African LGBT Activist Yaa Sissi on International Day of Older Persons
title: Africa: 'It Took Me Over 30 Years to Come Out. I Stopped Crying' - Witness

description: [Africa Renewal] 'Unstoppable Africa' summit concludes with key announcements and commitments to drive growth
title: Africa: Global Leaders Unite to Propel Africa's Business, Innovation Potential

description: [Africa Renewal] Why technical and vocational education and training is essential for equipping young Africans with the skills needed for a thriving society
title: Africa: Unlocking the Potential of Africa's Youth
